intro: Jehlia galeottii, commonly known as the Mexican firebush, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 3 meters, featuring woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of bright red or orange tubular flowers, which are adapted for pollination by birds and insects. Its flowering period occurs during the summer months, and it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Jehlia galeottii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
